question: 脱ぐ
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>undress</kanji> and the verb is <vocabulary>to undress</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: When you go <vocabulary>to undress</vocabulary> your goal is to become <reading>nu</reading>de (<ja>ぬ</ja>).
